item.title: Beate add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Beate add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Beate add a quote by John Ruskin
item.description: "Say all you have to say in the fewest possible words, or your reader will be sure to skip them; and in the plainest possible words or he will certainly misunderstand them." -- John Ruskin

item.title: Beate add a quote by Colin Greenland
item.description: "Plotting is like sex. Plotting is about desire and satisfaction, anticipation and release. You have to arouse your reader’s desire to know what happens, to unravel the mystery, to see good triumph. You have to sustain it, keep it warm, feed it, just a little bit, not too much at a time, as your story goes on. That’s called suspense. It can bring desire to a frenzy, in which case you are in a good position to bring off a wonderful climax." -- Colin Greenland

item.title: Beate add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Beate add a quote by A.B. Guthrie Jr.
item.description: "Nouns and verbs are the guts of the language. Beware of covering up with adjectives and adverbs." -- A.B. Guthrie Jr.

item.title: Beate add a quote by Judy Garland
item.description: "Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." -- Judy Garland

item.title: Beate add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Beate add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Beate add a quote by Jack Dixon
item.description: "If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results." -- Jack Dixon

item.title: Beate add a quote by John Wooden
item.description: "Do not let what you can't do interfere with what you can do." -- John Wooden

item.title: Beate add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Beate add a quote by Christie Silvers
item.description: "A writer's life is never boring when you have imaginary friends to play with!" -- Christie Silvers

item.title: Beate add a quote by Elizabeth Cady Stanton
item.description: "The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls." -- Elizabeth Cady Stanton

item.title: Beate add a quote by Cesare Pavese
item.description: "We do not remember days, we remember moments. The richness of life lies in memories we have forgotten" -- Cesare Pavese

item.title: Beate add a quote by Graycie Harmon
item.description: "Being an author is having angels whisper in your ear - and devils, too." -- Graycie Harmon

item.title: Beate add a quote by Daniel Pinkwater
item.description: "I went to college, but I learned to write by reading and writing." -- Daniel Pinkwater

item.title: Beate add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Beate add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Beate add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: Beate add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Beate add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Beate add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Beate add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Beate add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Beate add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beate add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "Memory is a snare, pure and simple; it alters, it subtly rearranges the past to fit the present." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Beate add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Beate add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description:
"Most men don't seem to get that telling a pissed-off woman to calm down is like throwing gunpowder on a fire.”
~ Liberty Jones" -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Beate add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon
